ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned a lot of French, very engaging class.
I learned so much about the french language and french culture.
I learned a lot of French!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The weekly tests were a lot and weren't very conducive to learning. Otherwise, the class was good.

Great course! Maybe could benefit from mandatory speaking tables. During my time at Yale, I also took L1-L3 Italian. We were required to attend a table once every month. I found the tables extremely helpful for carrying a basic conversation in Italian. Also, I think one test every 2 weeks would be sufficient. A test per week did not allow enough time for concepts to sink in, and many students found it stressful to cram for a test every Monday.
I thought that the french tests seemed a little excessive and hard to manage when other tests were the same night.

I learned a lot of French and I owe that to my amazing teacher Julie Hugonny. She was so unbelievably chill and such a patient but firm teacher. The tests every week were kind of dreadful but I guess they kept me in shape.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, good class, you will learn a lot of French.
Yes! Great way to learn french.
I would recommend this course to another student because I loved my teacher so much and class was enjoyable everyday.

Yes. Youll learn a lot. Be warned though that there is an at times overwhelming amount of homework and the tests every week are annoying. Your enjoyment of the course depends a lot on who you take it with.
